lead_paragraph: A report by Amnesty International said that many of the 1.2 million Afghans who have been forced from their homes were living in miserable conditions in camps.

byline.contributor: Najim Rahim contributed reporting from Kunduz, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and ZAHRA NADER

headline.print_headline: 1,000 Afghans Each Day Are Fleeing Their Homes
headline.main: Number of Displaced Afghans Has More Than Doubled Since 2013

snippet: A report by Amnesty International said that many of the 1.2 million Afghans who have been forced from their homes were living in miserable conditions in camps.
abstract: Amnesty International reports average of 1,000 Afghans are forced from their homes daily by country's 15-year-old conflict, more than double number of people forced to leave in 2013; report also shows resources dedicated to managing crisis have reached lowest point since 2009.
